Dataset.Name: Chest CT Dataset for Lung Nodule Detection

Reference.Title: Large-Scale Chest CT Dataset for Machine Learning Applications

Dataset.Comments: High-quality annotated chest CT dataset collected from multiple institutions
Dataset.Labeling: Each case labeled by expert radiologists for presence/absence of lung nodules with bounding box annotations
Dataset.Missing information: Some cases missing smoking history information
Dataset.External data: Self-contained dataset with no external dependencies
Dataset.Confidentiality: All PHI removed according to HIPAA Safe Harbor guidelines
Dataset.Subpopulations: Balanced distribution across age groups (18-90), gender (52% female), and nodule types
Dataset.Re-identification: Not possible - all identifiers removed and images processed to prevent re-identification
Dataset.Collection process: Retrospectively collected from 5 academic medical centers between 2020-2023

Representativeness.Population: Adults undergoing chest CT screening or diagnostic imaging
Representativeness.Verification: Demographics compared against national lung screening statistics

Motivation.Purpose: Create large-scale dataset for training and evaluation of lung nodule detection algorithms
Motivation.Team: Multi-institutional collaboration led by Medical Research Institute
Motivation.Funding: Supported by NSF and private foundation grants

Dataset.Partioning scheme: 70% training, 15% validation, 15% testing with patient-level split
